main event: An unidentified object, roughly the size of a softball at arm's length, was observed hovering in Canton, Ohio in 1937 for a duration of one minute, identified through ground-radar observation.
interesting points: The object was approximately the size of a softball at arm's length, indicating its relatively small size.
The duration of the sighting and the flight path suggested a probable cause of air-ship radar interference.
The report was categorized under ground-radar observation, indicating a technological basis for the sighting.
No photographs were captured during the observation.
The sighting was not attributed to any specific report in the file, leaving the nature of the object unexplained.
sighted object: unidentified object, roughly the size of a softball at arm's length
